title: Isabella County man, 81, accidently shoots himself
content:
An 81-year-old rural Isabella County man was taken to the hospital Friday morning after accidentally shooting himself with his handgun.
Sheriff Michael Main said the Isabella Township man thought the gun was empty and shot himself in the lower left leg about 7:35 a.m.
Deputies and an ambulance were called to the man’s home in the 1000 block of East Jordan Road, northwest of Mt. Pleasant.
“Deputies found the victim who had accidently shot himself in the lower left leg with a medium-sized caliber handgun,” Main said in a press release. “Deputies rendered first aid and applied pressure to the wound until medical first responders and Mobile Medical Response arrived and took over patient care.”

The man, who was not named in the press release, was taken to McLaren Central Michigan hospital in Mt. Pleasant and then flown to Covenent Medical Center in Saginaw with a non life-threatening injury, Main said.
“There is no information leading to believe that this incident is anything other than an accidental discharge of a weapon that was believed to be unloaded at the time,” Main said.
